content:
OO FHIR Block Vote for Thursday June 14th OO Conferenca Call

Comment Submitters

  • Bas van den Heuvel
  • Eric Haas
  • Floyd Eisenberg
  • Jack Wallace
  • Keith Salzman
  • Kevin Geminiuc
  • Lloyd McKenzie
  • Patrick Werner
  • Patty Craig
  • Simone Heckmann

Line Items

  • GF#16687 The comments on this section are useful - 2018-May Core Norm Observation %236 (Keith Salzman) In Person Considered - No action required
  • GF#16125 Device-kind (Kevin Geminiuc) Considered - Question Answered
  • GF#16697 Allowing the interpretation with a narrative statement makes this option useful for computing and human reading for clarificatino - 2018-May Core Norm Observation %2314 (Keith Salzman) In Person
  • GF#15947 add service provider instructions to ServiceRequest (Jack Wallace) In Person Not Persuasive
  • GF#16690 Include specifically photographs and other images made of slide speciments to clarify observations - 2018-May Core Norm Observation %237 (Keith Salzman) In Person Not Persuasive
  • GF#16859 The name of the resource is ambigu. The resource is not descibing a BodyStructure but information related a body structure in specific patient. - 2018-May Core STU %2353 (Bas van den Heuvel) Not Persuasive
  • GF#17166 Ability to indicate notDoneReason for a diet order consistent to MedicationRequest (Floyd Eisenberg) In Person Not Persuasive
  • GF#17205 Link DiagnosticReports hierarchically (Patrick Werner) Not Persuasive
  • GF#17239 Observation.value%5Bx%5D should have choice of datatype markdown (Simone Heckmann) Not Persuasive
  • GF#15825 Increase cardinality on Observation.focus (Lloyd McKenzie) Persuasive
  • GF#15846 review whether device implant status is a modifier extension or not (Eric Haas) Persuasive
  • GF#16809 CodeSystem Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes - correct grammer - 2018-May Core Norm Observation %2360 (Patty Craig) Persuasive
  • GF#17280 Task needs location as per the Event pattern (Lloyd McKenzie) Persuasive
  • GF#16064 DiagnosticReport requires Observation Components (Floyd Eisenberg) In Person Persuasive with Mod
